intro: Clathrotropis brachypetala var. brachypetala, commonly known as the short-petalled clathrotropis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
